group_1.textLeft: That girl being there really saved us.

group_1.textRight: Thanks to her, a time paradox hasn't occurred.
...Assuming the reason for us disappearing@was that, of course.

group_1.textLeft: Because the result was a contradiction in@causality...
We who are a part of a contradicting future@disappeared!
I believe that is what happened.

group_1.textRight: Then why do only our voices remain, but our@disappearance stopped halfway...?

group_1.textLeft: That girl calling out to us increased the chances@of us continuing to exist.
So that's why our disappearing forms returned.

group_1.textRight: ...Then why did we disappear again?

group_1.textLeft: Because Tsukasa ignored us!

group_1.textRight: ...So that's why.
Did she simply ignore us, or in this instance was@she just too far from the store?

group_1.textLeft: You're right about that point.
She just miraculously remembered her errands@afterwards...
And barely saved us!

group_1.textRight: What's important is that the worse the contradiction@is, the more faded all traces of us become.

group_1.textLeft: Ah... Thank you for earlier.

group_1.textRight: Did I...help Guardian Spirit...?

group_1.textLeft: Uh-huh!
You may not be able to tell, but that was critical@timing!

group_1.textRight: [chara:801200:effect_emotion_joy_0][se:7222_happy]Woww...that's great!
I love "Christmas Bonds."
I read the story about Guardian Spirits over and@over again!
Ah...but...
Do the real Guardian Spirits know about that@book?

group_1.textLeft: A book written about us...you say?
It's a very rare book, but I hear it's difficult to@get your hands on, though.

group_1.textRight: Yeah... It's only in our library, so I borrow it a@lot so I can read it again.

group_1.textLeft: ...I have the same experience. No matter how many@times I read my favorite book, it's always fun.

group_1.textRight: Does Guardian Spirit also visit the library?

group_1.textLeft: Ah, yeah...you could say that.

group_1.textCenter: Kuu, where are you? You know it's about time@to go?

group_1.textRight: Ah, Mama...!

group_1.textLeft: There you are. Well then, shall we go?

group_1.textRight: Yeah!

group_1.textLeft: Tomorrow would you like to go visit Mii's house?

group_1.textRight: ...No, I want to go to the library.

group_1.textLeft: Oh, you do?

group_1.textRight: Ah...
See you, Guardian Spirits!
Keep reconnecting the bonds that tie everyone,@okay!

group_1.textLeft: You saved us today!
We'll see you again.
"A book written about us...you say?"
You were able to talk around her well.

group_1.textRight: Telling the truth to a girl like her would be cruel.
She didn't seem suspicious about anything,@so my acting must have been good enough.

group_1.textLeft: She said "keep reconnecting the bonds that tie@everyone," though...
Is something like that in the book?

group_1.textRight: The story I heard about is a fairy tale set on@Christmas.
A pair of Guardian Spirits reconnect the frayed@bonds of people...
It was a story like that.

group_1.textLeft: Hmmm...
Perhaps we're having these encounters...
Because this diary is that "Christmas Bonds"@book...?

group_1.textRight: ...I don't see a title on it.
Huh?
The page turned on its own...

group_1.textLeft: It started shining...!
